Counts [[entities]] ([[players]], [[mobs]], [[items]], etc.) matching specified conditions.

==Syntax==

: <code>testfor <victim: target></code>

==Arguments==

{{argument|be=1|victim: target|CommandSelector<Actor>}}
: Specifies the entities to test.
: {{arg desc|be=actor}}

==Result==

{{Result table|onlybe=1}}
{{Result table|The command is incomplete, or any argument is not specified correctly.||unparseable}}
{{Result table|<code>victim: target</code> fails to resolve to one or more entities (named players must be online).||fail}}
{{Result table|succeed}}
{{Result table}}

== Output ==

{{Output table|onlybe=1}}
{{Output table|On fail|0}}
{{Output table|On success|the number of the specified entities.}}
{{Output table}}

==Examples==

* To test if Alice is online: <code>testfor Alice</code>
* To count the number of players in Survival mode within a 3-block radius of (0,64,0): <code>testfor @a[x=0,y=64,z=0,r=3,m=0]</code>
* To count the number of zombies within a 20-block radius of (0,64,0): <code>testfor @e[x=0,y=64,z=0,r=20,type=zombie]</code>
* To check if a random player has iron ingots in their inventory  <code>testfor @r[hasitem={item=iron_ingot}]</code>
* To check if a random player does not have iron ingots in their inventory  <code>testfor @r[hasitem={item=iron_ingot},quantity=0]</code>
* To check if a random is holding iron ingots in their inventory  <code>testfor @r[hasitem={item=iron_ingot},location=slots.weapon.mainhand]</code>
